title: Intelligent Multimedia Processing (IMP) for Enterprises
description: Orchestrated an LLM-driven pipeline using RAG architecture to enable natural language querying over multimedia transcripts (Text, Audio, Video), enhancing user interaction by 40%. Curated and indexed audio-visual content using FAISS and HuggingFace Longform Transformers, optimizing retrieval accuracy with a Top-k Precision of 92%. Integrated MLOps tools MLflow, and FastAPI for scalable deployment, reducing model latency by 30%. Implemented automated Argo CI/CD pipelines with Docker Compose and GitHub Actions, reducing deployment time by 70%.

title: NYC MTA Urban Transit Reliability and Demand Forecasting
description: Formulated a scalable Spark-based ingestion workflow to aggregate and cleanse 30 GB of subway ridership data, streamlining database maintenance. Evaluated ridership metrics using time-series aggregations and calendar-heatmap visualizations. Programmed ETL pipelines and PySpark jobs to automate cleaning-validation, reducing manual processing time by 30%. Integrated station metadata with ridership counts into unified dashboards for data-driven resource-allocation.

title: Adversarial Attacks on ImageNet Classifiers
description: Explored adversarial attacks (FGSM, PGD, Patch-based) against a pre-trained ResNet-34 classifier on ImageNet-1K. Implemented and evaluated these attacks to demonstrate performance degradation of deep networks and studied the transferability of adversarial examples to DenseNet-121.

title: Fine-tuning RoBERTa with LoRA for Text Classification
description: Fine-tuned RoBERTa, an open-source LLM, using Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) for a text classification task, managing <1M trainable parameters. Achieved rank 109 in a Kaggle competition by optimizing model hyperparameters and training procedures.

title: Modified ResNet for CIFAR-10 Classification (<5M Params)
description: Trained and tested a modified ResNet architecture with fewer than 5 million parameters on the CIFAR-10 image classification dataset. Achieved rank 21 in a Kaggle competition by implementing effective training strategies and test-time augmentation.

title: British Airways Customer Booking Analysis
description: Analyzed 500,000+ customer booking records to identify trends in cancellations, rebookings, and seasonal demand. Designed predictive models using Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn) to forecast customer behavior, reducing over-booking errors by 20%. Implemented SQL-based ETL pipelines, improving data processing speed by 30%. Constructed interactive Tableau dashboards for real-time monitoring.

title: Detection of GAN Generated Images
description: Analyzed image processing workflows and machine learning pipelines, resulting in a 15% improvement in classification accuracy to distinguish CycleGAN-generated images from real images with 96% accuracy using TensorFlow and PyTorch. Designed a data augmentation strategy that reduced overfitting by 25% and boosted precision by 20% through hyperparameter tuning and transfer learning.

title: Music Recommendation System (NYU Bootcamp - Best Project Award)
description: Developed an AI-driven music recommendation system providing personalized song suggestions. Implemented KNN, K-Means, Fuzzy Wuzzy string matching, and LIME for model interpretability. Involved data preprocessing with Pandas & NumPy, feature engineering, and building an interactive API. Awarded Best Project Presentation at NYU Data Science Bootcamp.

title: NYC Open Data Analysis
description: Performed exploratory data analysis on Brooklyn Bridge pedestrian trends and Manhattan tree data, uncovering seasonal patterns and environmental impacts. Engineered a linear regression model to predict daily pedestrian volume based on climate variables, improving forecasting accuracy by 15%. Developed interactive visualizations using Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Folium.

title: Dashboards: Analyzing Employee Trends & Call Center Data
description: Developed interactive dashboards for analyzing employee trends and call center data, providing actionable insights for decision-making and performance monitoring.
